title: Morning Journal and Poop Bag Solution

screenplay.rawText:
INT. JASON’S ART STUDIO – MORNING
Stacey enters the dim studio as Jason finishes writing in a notebook. He explains his need to clear his head and his frustration with dumpster diving. He abruptly exits and is later found crouched over a trash can. Jason admits he defecates in a bag to deter dumpster divers, shocking Stacey. After disposing of the bag, he resumes painting.
actions: Stacey enters the dimly lit studio.
Jason sits at his workbench, writing in a notebook.
He finishes a page and finally acknowledges Stacey.
Jason explains his stream-of-consciousness journaling ritual.
He mentions the recurring trash problem and says he's going to 'fix it.'
Jason prepares to paint: puts on gloves, shakes dropper bottle, pours paint.
Jason suddenly announces he's stepping away and goes into the back room.
Stacey waits, then goes to check on him.
She finds Jason crouched over a trash can, telling her not to come in.
Jason emerges tying off a plastic garbage bag.
Jason reluctantly admits he defecated in a bag as a deterrent for dumpster scavengers.
Jason confidently asserts that the method works and he's done it before.
Jason takes the tied bag out to the dumpster and throws it away.
He discards his gloves and puts on a clean pair.
The painting process resumes, then transitions into time-lapse.
Title card or transition: Day 5 of painting.

lines: Hi! I was just clearing my head before getting started on the painting.

Anything bouncing around in my head needs to get out before I start painting.. I was just writing a stream of conciseness until I started writing about all the trash around my dumpster again today.. I’m going to fix that. The dumpster diving is going to stop.
Um.. I shouldn’t say.. No, I’m not going to say. Okay, time to paint!
Don’t come back here! I’ll be out in a minute.
Uh.. When the um.. When people dig threw my dumpster and throw trash all over the place, I.. I shit in a bag for them to find the next time they make a mess.
I know.. It’s gross. But it works. This stops the dumpster diving for a few months.. Believe me, it works.
Yep! Well, yes a few times. It really works.
Haha—— Yes. New gloves, of course!
I know.. It really is.. ..Anyway, time to paint.
Sorry about what? What were you doing?
Pease tell me you’re going to change your gloves.

narrative.summary: Jason begins his morning with journaling to clear his mind, revealing ongoing frustration with dumpster divers. His solution — defecating in a bag as a deterrent — shocks Stacey and introduces a dark comedic edge to his character. After disposing of the bag, Jason resumes painting.
narrative.beatPurpose: Expose Jason’s psychologically unstable but oddly practical side; deepen the documentary’s tone by introducing absurd, disturbing realism; maintain the progression of the painting schedule.
narrative.conflict: Jason vs. dumpster divers; Jason’s internal instability; Stacey’s discomfort with his increasingly strange behavior.
narrative.stakes: Jason’s mental state is degrading as pressure mounts; the documentary now has an unexpected and volatile subject.
narrative.outcome: Jason resets emotionally (in his own way) and returns to work; tension increases between Jason’s artist persona and his private eccentricities.
themes: Documentary vérité — capturing the unfiltered truth
